summary: Feature request to disable GitHub's "require branches to be up to date before merging" requirement for faster PR merging. Currently, every time a PR is merged, all other PRs are blocked and require manual updating and rerunning of checks.
userImpact: Reduces developer friction and PR merge time by eliminating the requirement to update and re-run checks on every PR after another PR is merged.
rootCause: GitHub branch protection rule requiring PRs to be up to date with main before merging causes cascading delays when multiple PRs exist.
proposedFix: Disable the branch protection rule that requires branches to be up to date before merging, accepting the trade-off of potentially discovering test failures on main rather than before merge.
workaround: Manually click 'Update branch' and use 'Enable auto-merge', though this still requires manual intervention for failed checks and can fail if another PR is merged concurrently.
resolutionDetails: The repository maintainer (bergundy) disabled the GitHub branch protection setting as requested.
keyQuote: We uncheck this box... Pro: takes much less time to merge PRs. Con: slightly less safe: delayed knowledge of failure.
